name: Flutter Study Jam
description:
Details:

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

The target audience for Flutter Study Jam:
1) Those just getting started with mobile app development
2) Those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Why be a part of this Study Jam?
-> Work with Google instructors step-by-step to build a fully functional native “Unit Converter App” for both iOS and Android using Flutter
-> Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Flutter application
-> Learn about fundamentals: UI Widgets, App State, Material Design, User Interaction and Gestures, and Packages
-> Learn how to structure and architect your app and use Flutter's tooling to build apps efficiently

Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Note: Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

If you have any problems installing flutter do not hesitate to send a message to the organizer. Alternatively we will help you get set up at the meet-up.
how_to_find_us: We'll be in 'Program Room'. Please ask at reception if needed.

name: Android Dev Summit Viewing Party

venue.name: Cineplex Cinemas Marine Gateway and VIP

description:
Details

First things first. This exclusive event requires a registration on the event website

You MUST RSVP in the following site to attend this premiere event.
https://events.withgoogle.com/android-dev-summit-viewing-parties/
_________________________________________________________________________________

We invite you to the special & unique viewing parties ever!

Android Dev Summit is happening on November 7-8, 2018 in Computer History Museum. We wanted to make this special event more accessible and create a great experience for you.

Join the experience in a movie theater to watch livestream summit at the viewing party

We reserved your spot for the Android Dev Summit viewing parties in many cities and movie theaters. While you're watching the sessions live, you'll meet other developers and learn about the new Android updates. There will be food and a great atmosphere. Come and join the party

name: GDG Burnaby DevFest'18
description:
**

RSVP here doesn't guarantee admission. To guarantee admission, buy tickets here: https://gdgburnabydevfest18.eventbrite.com/

Website: https://gdg-burnaby-web-app.firebaseapp.com/

**

GDG Burnaby, in collaboration with IEEE Vancouver CS Chapter brings to you it's biggest event- GDG DevFest'18.

This year we aim to bring together people who shape the future of ML, Web and Security technologies at 6 hours of sessions, workshops and networking. Described by many as 'Google I/O of Google Community Events', our team creates DevFest to be the best place for inspiration and experience sharing.

Speakers:
1.Kyle Hunslow

-Machine Learning Engineer and AI Tech Lead for Digitalist Vancouver Studio.

Session: Intro to Object Detection and Semantic Segmentation for Self Driving Car Applications

Kyle will introduce some popular Deep Learning and Computer Vision techniques currently used in the self-driving car industry. He'll outline the workflow for training Convolutional Neural Networks to perform object detection and semantic segmentation tasks. You'll get hands on experience with Tensorflow and Python through an interactive Jupyter Notebook session hosted in Google Colab. It is highly recommended that you follow along with the live coding session, so don't forget your laptop! Please prepare by signing up and getting familiar with Colab.

2. Sarah Kraynick

-CE0/Cyber Security Consultant -Social Engineer (Former- Women Techmakers Berlin)

Session: Who is in your pocket? Security and Privacy for Mobile Developers

With mobile and IoT devices proliferating at an exponential rate security is more important than ever. Sarah is here to discuss the threats and ways to mitigate these threats as a developer. This talk will mainly be focused on the Android OS and Android App development, though will also have lots to offer for those interested in mobile/IoT security as a whole.

3.Bob Gill

-Vice Chair, IEEE Computing Science Vancouver

Session : Sustainable Solution for Smart Cities

Bob has been associated will IEEE Vancouver more than 15 years now. In past he has served as the chair of IEEE Vancouver Section and is currently heading the Computing Science Section. He is a Fellow of Engineers Canada and has served APEGBC in various capacities and presently serving as a member on Mentoring committee. He will present some sustainable solutions for building the future smart city.

4. Cleo Espiritu: Google Developer Expert for G-Suite

Session: Transforming business processes with G-Suite and Google App Maker

Can we get "non-coders" to design and build apps with minimal assistance? Why would we want to do so? In this lightning talk, we will discuss how Google App Maker and Apps Script enables "citizen developers" to create solutions to transform their business processe

Keep yourself posted as we add more speakers! Want to buy tickets, checkout the link here:

Ticket: https://gdgburnabydevfest18.eventbrite.com/
Website: https://gdg-burnaby-web-app.firebaseapp.com/

Venue: Please check the map. It is 5 minutes walking from Metrotown Skytrain!
how_to_find_us: Enter the building of Hotel Element and take the stairs to second floor

name: Flutter Live Viewing Party
description:
GDG Burnaby in collaboration with IEEE SFU Chapter brings to you Flutter Live.

Organized on December 4th, it is to experience the latest from Flutter, Google’s free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase. Presented from the Science Museum in London, it is an efforty to optimize Flutter Live to reach the largest audience of mobile developers and provide all the rigor and excitement of an in-person experience to our global online audience.
how_to_find_us: Room No- ASB 9705 (Look for Applied Science Building Reception Office)

name: DevFest OnAir (Online)
description:
Did you miss Google Developer DevFest of Burnaby? No worries, we have got you covered. You can now watch multiple sessions online from DevFest around the world. Does that sound interesting to you? Read below!

********
You need to register for this event:
Website: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18
********

DevFest OnAir is an online conference featuring sessions from DevFest events around the globe. These community-led developer sessions are hosted by GDG (Google Developer Groups) focused on community, networking and learning about Google technologies. With over 500 communities and DevFest events happening all over the world, DevFest OnAir brings this global experience online for the first time!

Agenda: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18#schedule

Speakers: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18/speakers#

#Exclusive content.

DevFest OnAir includes exclusive content from Google. Switch between three separate tracks: Cloud; Mobile; Voice, Web & more. Sessions cover multiple products such as Android, Google Cloud Platform, Firebase, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and mobile web.

#Tailored to your time zone.

Anyone can join, no matter where you are. We’re hosting three broadcasts around the world, around the clock, so there’s a convenient time for you to join no matter where you are at home or at work.

#Ask us a question live.

We will have live Q&A forum will be open throughout the online event to spark conversation and get you the answers you need.

#Fun!

Join the fun with interactive trivia during DevFest OnAir where you can receive something special! Every participant will receive one free month of learning on Qwiklabs.

name: Global Diversity CFP Day (Vancouver)
description:
*** You need to buy your FREE ticket to attend this event. RSVPs here does not guarantee admission. Ticket link below***

Are you a member of an underrepresented or marginalized group? Have you always wanted to become a tech conference speaker?

Let 2019 be the year that you make that dream a reality!
Save the date - Saturday 2nd March 2019

On Saturday 2nd March 2019, you can attend the second edition of Global Diversity CFP Day following the success of the 2018 global event where 53 workshops took place around the world!

GDG Burnaby and Women Techmakers Burnaby highly encourage newbie speakers to attend this day-long workshop and put together their first talk proposal. It is a good medium to share your own individual perspective on any subject of interest to people in tech.

Link: https://www.globaldiversitycfpday.com/events/187

Each workshop will have experienced speakers on hand to:

1. give you a warm, inclusive welcome in a safe space
2. mentor you with your proposal
3. provide speaking advice
4. and share their enthusiasm to get you to the stage!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This will also be a good start if you are interested in submitting a talk for our upcoming International Women's Day 2019 Celebration, hosted by Women Techmakers Burnaby, on March 11, 2019.

Links:
IWD'19: https://www.meetup.com/gdg-burnaby/events/258773667/

Buy tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wtm-international-womens-day-celebration-iwd19-tickets-57062203587

Talk Submission: https://goo.gl/forms/ei6wWRRkDIpZ7qGz2

name: [WTM] International Women's Day Celebration (IWD'19)
description:
**** PLEASE REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE:
https://iwdcelebration-2019.eventbrite.com ****

*** This event is being co-organized with Burnaby Tech Meetup. Please buy tickets at only one place ***

Join the Women Techmakers Burnaby, Burnaby Tech Meetup, and Google Developers Group Burnaby communities for a celebration of International Women's Day on March 11th at CMPNY!

With International Women's Day taking place on March 8th, we hope that you'll be inspired and energized to join us to celebrate women's contributions to our tech community and build connections to continue these conversations beyond IWD. This event is open to anyone identifying as a woman, as well as our allies. We look forward to an evening of meaningful conversations and connections.

Agenda:
5:30PM - Registration and Networking
6:00PM - Welcome and Introductions
6:10PM - Speaker Session: "How to Enter Open Source and Thrive In It"
6:30PM - Lightning Talk
6:40PM - Roundtable Breakout Sessions
7:15PM - Networking
7:30PM - Event Ends

What to Expect:
**Speaker Session** - "How to Enter Open Source and Thrive In It"

Irene Storozhko, Software Engineer at Mozilla, will be our speaker for the event. She'll talk about:
- how to choose and where to find a project,
- which tools would be needed (version control, editors, communication tools); how to contribute
- some good practices to follow (technical & communication-wise)
- open source opportunities (GSoC, Outreachy)

** Lightning Talk** - "Empowering Women: Public Speaking at Tech Events"

Jill Binder is Founder and Consultant at 'Diverse Speakers in Tech'. She was named one of the top 100 Influencers of WordPress in 2014 by Torque Magazine and one of the top 10 Women of WordPress by CloudWays. She will talk about women doing public speaking at technology events. Her talk will share why it matters and the positive changes that resulted in our community.

**Roundtable Sessions** - We'll be splitting off into groups for deeper discussions. During these sessions, you'll have the opportunity to further encourage and engage women in tech, and socialize and find support for any challenges you may be facing.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Interested in volunteering for the event? Please email us at [masked]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Venue Sponsor: CMPNY (www.cmpny.com)
CMPNY Coworking is the partner for small business, startups and contract workers in Vancouver. Our community understands that the future of business takes grit, constant learning and the right environment to succeed as an independent. With a community of hustlers and entrepreneurs, there is a flow of information that occurs & helps members stay supported in their drive toward their professional aspirations. The future of work has changed & we are happy to be apart of it.

Sponsor: BCjobs.ca (www.bcjobs.ca)
As Western Canada's largest job board, BCjobs.ca has been connecting job seekers to leading companies in Greater Vancouver and throughout British Columbia for over 16 years. Focused on its community, BCjobs.ca understands the local hiring market, economy, and companies that make up the fabric of our great province. Connecting talented job seekers with top local employers both online and in real life -- BCjobs.ca is your trusted career and workplace partner.

Logistics Sponsor: Google Developer Relations (https://developers.google.com/programs/community/gdg/)
Google Developers supports and recognizes GDG chapters, but doesn’t own or manage them. This is the team behind all the rich, technical content on developers.google.com, as well as the people you’re likely to see speaking at Google I/O.

Disclaimer: GDG Burnaby is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. Learn more at: https://www.meetup.com/gdg-burnaby/
